DOC.brief_summary: The study aim evaluate efficacy percutaneous tibial nerve stimulation ( PTNS ) associate conservative therapy ( arm A ) treatment low anterior resection syndrome ( LARS ) compare conservative therapy ( arm B ) . The secondary aim evaluation follow parameter : - Effect PTNS manometric parameter - Effect PTNS quality life - Effect PTNS severity fecal incontinence / obstruct defecation - Safety PTNS
DOC.brief_title: Percutaneous Tibial Nerve Stimulation Treatment Anterior Resection Syndrome After Rectal Cancer Surgery
DOC.detailed_description: The study prospective randomize clinical trial compare two treatment patient LARS : Arm A : PTNS + conservative treatment ( base predominant symptom ) Arm B : conservative treatment The study divide two phase : 1 . PRETREATMENT PHASE The patient LARS score ≥ 21 anterior resection rectum sphincter-saving surgery rectal cancer , submit first visit study : - Collection personal data - Collection medical record - Collection data relate intervention anterior resection rectum - Verification criterion inclusion / exclusion - Collection inform consent - Administration questionnaires European Organisation Research Treatment Cancer - Quality Life Questionnaire Cancer 30 ( EORTC QLQ-C30 ) , European Organisation Research Treatment Cancer - Quality Life Questionnaire Colorectal 38 ( EORTC QLQ-CR38 ) , Faecal incontinence severity index ( FISI ) ; Fecal incontinence quality life questionnaire ( FIQL ) , Obstructed defaecation syndrome ( ODS ) score questionnaire Constipation-related quality life questionnaire ( CRQoL ) - Endoanal ultrasound - Anorectal manometry 2 . PHASE OF TREATMENT During treatment phase , data related treatment treatment related-complications record special form Bowel function quality life assess use questionnaire end treatment . Even anorectal manometry repeat end treatment . It expect enroll approximately 12 patient .
